00:00:12.234 --> 00:00:14.145

00:00:14.280 --> 00:00:17.349
1) anxiety can make your throat feel sore or tight

00:00:17.350 --> 00:00:20.070
even like there is a "literal lump in your throat"

00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:23.509
this is referred to as a "globus sensation" in medical terms

00:00:23.510 --> 00:00:26.310
and is a direct result of muscle bracing from anxiety

00:00:26.600 --> 00:00:27.854
2) disrupted breathing

00:00:27.855 --> 00:00:29.423
either difficulty getting a full breath

00:00:29.424 --> 00:00:31.823
tightness in chest or heart palpitations

00:00:31.824 --> 00:00:35.623
the fight/flight response as a component of anxiety prioritizes oxygen

00:00:35.624 --> 00:00:39.823
and therefore bloodflow to the muscles & away from your internal organs

00:00:39.824 --> 00:00:42.275
this can make breathing feel weird & labored

00:00:42.640 --> 00:00:44.830

00:00:44.831 --> 00:00:47.590

00:00:47.591 --> 00:00:48.127

00:00:48.128 --> 00:00:51.230

00:00:51.231 --> 00:00:52.548
your arms and legs

00:00:52.551 --> 00:00:55.208
while dizziness or lightheadedness is common due to 

00:00:55.209 --> 00:00:56.588
LACK of oxygen in the brain

00:00:56.631 --> 00:00:59.388
4) depersonalization & derealization

00:00:59.480 --> 00:01:03.106
these out of body body experiences can feel REALLY weird & scary

00:01:03.153 --> 00:01:06.466

00:01:06.473 --> 00:01:09.506
in your bloodstream from the fight or flight response from anxiety

00:01:09.713 --> 00:01:11.632
this can look like your limbs feeling strange

00:01:11.633 --> 00:01:13.152
your face looking weird in the mirror

00:01:13.153 --> 00:01:14.312
life feeling unreal

00:01:14.313 --> 00:01:15.986
feeling detached from reality

00:01:16.113 --> 00:01:17.312
feeling disconnected from your body

00:01:17.313 --> 00:01:19.266
or like everything is moving in slow motion

00:01:19.480 --> 00:01:21.920
if your symptoms are negatively impacting your life

00:01:21.921 --> 00:01:24.480
consider learning more about managing your mental health

00:01:24.481 --> 00:01:26.400
regulating your central nervous system

00:01:26.401 --> 00:01:28.040
and even reaching out to a professional

00:01:28.041 --> 00:01:30.738
for help with managing or reducing those symptoms

00:01:31.081 --> 00:01:32.658
life doesn't have to be like that

00:01:32.921 --> 00:01:34.378
and you don't have to suffer alone

Here are my 3 top tips as a therapist

00:00:02.511 --> 00:00:05.228
to overcome health anxiety.

00:00:06.151 --> 00:00:10.628
Number one, you have to recognize what's happening.

00:00:10.791 --> 00:00:13.108
If we don't name it as health anxiety,

00:00:13.551 --> 00:00:14.870
we tend to continue

00:00:14.871 --> 00:00:17.068
going round and round with the patterns

00:00:17.231 --> 00:00:19.748
because we're trying to think our way

00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:21.330
to a feeling of safety.

00:00:21.489 --> 00:00:23.770
If you can name it as health anxiety,

00:00:24.129 --> 00:00:26.410
you can address the health anxiety

00:00:26.929 --> 00:00:29.650
as opposed to trying to address the symptoms,

00:00:29.729 --> 00:00:31.610
which may not be the real issue.

00:00:32.463 --> 00:00:36.156
Secondly, we have to then break the pattern.

00:00:36.303 --> 00:00:38.636
If you can recognize what's happening,

00:00:38.863 --> 00:00:39.942
you then have to stop

00:00:39.943 --> 00:00:42.956
the habits and the behaviors that perpetuate the cycle.

00:00:43.183 --> 00:00:44.982
So the constant checking of symptoms,

00:00:44.983 --> 00:00:46.422
researching of symptoms,

00:00:46.423 --> 00:00:48.596
looking for reassurance about symptoms.

00:00:48.783 --> 00:00:50.796
We have to break those patterns and cycles.

00:00:51.320 --> 00:00:52.228
And then thirdly,

00:00:52.231 --> 00:00:53.468
the recognition

00:00:53.751 --> 00:00:56.828
that what health anxiety often really is

00:00:57.071 --> 00:00:59.548
is an inner sense of not feeling safe.

00:00:59.631 --> 00:01:02.988
So if we can work on calming your nervous system

00:01:03.151 --> 00:01:06.508
and cultivating that inner state of safety,

00:01:07.137 --> 00:01:09.576
you won't need to have those health anxieties

00:01:09.577 --> 00:01:10.762
in the first place.

00:01:11.337 --> 00:01:12.416
To learn how to do that,

00:01:12.417 --> 00:01:15.282
do follow for more videos in this series.

00:00:07.262 --> 00:00:10.261
The first sign is an obsession with how you feel.

00:00:10.262 --> 00:00:12.621
You suddenly feel weird, different to how you used to,

00:00:12.622 --> 00:00:15.261
and you feel the sense of doom and trepidation.

00:00:15.262 --> 00:00:18.641
The second sign is you're bombarded with what if thoughts,

00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:20.660
scary what if thoughts, not the fun ones,

00:00:20.661 --> 00:00:22.181
usually about your sanity,

00:00:22.182 --> 00:00:24.261
your well being, your health.

00:00:24.262 --> 00:00:27.901
The third sign, a strange symptoms that feel magnified.

00:00:27.902 --> 00:00:31.741
Heart palpitations, maybe feel dissociated and not quite here.

00:00:31.742 --> 00:00:34.781
Maybe you feel dizzy, lightheaded and things just look strange.

00:00:34.782 --> 00:00:36.761
No. 4 is intrusive thoughts,

00:00:36.860 --> 00:00:37.700
strange taboo

00:00:37.701 --> 00:00:40.581
ones that you usually don't have or they usually don't bother you.

00:00:40.582 --> 00:00:42.381
Suddenly they now feel important.

00:00:42.382 --> 00:00:44.821
Number five is constant reassurance seeking.

00:00:44.822 --> 00:00:46.581
Maybe you've been down a Reddit hole

00:00:46.582 --> 00:00:48.541
constantly asking Doctor, Google,

00:00:48.542 --> 00:00:50.261
yet you're still there in the same place

00:00:50.262 --> 00:00:52.581
trying to find 100% assurance that you're okay.

00:00:52.582 --> 00:00:55.501
Number six is experiencing a lot of panic attacks

00:00:55.502 --> 00:00:57.141
and fearing those panic attacks.

00:00:57.142 --> 00:00:58.381
One hits you out the blue,

00:00:58.382 --> 00:00:59.741
you're not sure what's going on,

00:00:59.742 --> 00:01:01.541
so you monitor for it all day

00:01:01.542 --> 00:01:04.421
because you're afraid of having another panic attack

00:01:04.422 --> 00:01:06.721
and then you build your life around avoiding them.

00:01:06.860 --> 00:01:08.720
No.7 is threat monitoring.

00:01:08.780 --> 00:01:12.700
You're monitoring either your thoughts or sensations in your body

00:01:12.701 --> 00:01:14.601
looking for the next threat

00:01:14.740 --> 00:01:17.680
or uncomfortable experience that frightens you.

00:01:17.720 --> 00:01:21.340
No.8 is you resist and fear the emotion of anxiety.

00:01:21.341 --> 00:01:24.381
You try To get rid of it, maybe you've looked for lots of things like

00:01:24.382 --> 00:01:25.501
how do I get rid of this now?

00:01:25.502 --> 00:01:27.001
How to stop a panic attack,

00:01:27.120 --> 00:01:28.580
anything to try and get rid of it.

00:01:28.581 --> 00:01:32.501
And that urgency, No. 9 is that you avoid doing stuff that you used to,

00:01:32.502 --> 00:01:34.341
that what non anxious you would do,

00:01:34.342 --> 00:01:37.341
you've put off because you're waiting to feel better.

00:01:37.342 --> 00:01:40.401
No. 10, anxiety becomes your default thought.

00:01:40.520 --> 00:01:42.460
Whenever you're not distracted or busy,

00:01:42.461 --> 00:01:45.061
you check how you feel and it's the default thought.

00:01:45.062 --> 00:01:47.981
I must fix myself, I must work on this,

00:01:47.982 --> 00:01:51.301
I must get rid of this. And it becomes the centre of your life.

00:01:51.302 --> 00:01:53.261
I've been there. I've got through it.

00:01:53.262 --> 00:01:55.281
So inspired me to be a therapist.

00:01:55.380 --> 00:01:59.560
And if this resonates, my work in this page might help.

00:00:00.020 --> 00:00:01.300
This is the anxious brain,

00:00:01.301 --> 00:00:03.121
and this is the non anxious brain.

00:00:03.180 --> 00:00:05.940
Each piece represents an anxious thought.

00:00:05.941 --> 00:00:08.101
Both brains get the same thought.

00:00:08.102 --> 00:00:10.521
What if I eat something contaminated?

00:00:10.580 --> 00:00:14.600
The anxious brain panics. It needs certainty.

00:00:14.720 --> 00:00:17.500
So it seeks reassurance, checking labels,

00:00:17.501 --> 00:00:19.541
researching food safety, asking others,

00:00:19.542 --> 00:00:22.201
maybe even avoiding certain foods altogether.

00:00:22.300 --> 00:00:25.920
And for a moment, the anxiety disappears.

00:00:26.100 --> 00:00:29.500
But here is the problem. It's not really gone.

00:00:29.501 --> 00:00:35.341
It's lingering. And now the brain has Learned uncertainty is dangerous.

00:00:35.342 --> 00:00:37.521
I need to do this again next time.

00:00:37.780 --> 00:00:42.060
So the anxiety grows. The next meal comes,

00:00:42.061 --> 00:00:44.901
the thought returns, what if this food is contaminated?

00:00:44.902 --> 00:00:47.561
The anxious brain reacts the same way.

00:00:47.620 --> 00:00:49.740
More checking, more researching,

00:00:49.741 --> 00:00:52.141
more avoiding. And it's gone.

00:00:52.142 --> 00:00:54.241
For now. But it returns,

00:00:54.300 --> 00:00:58.080
stronger this time. And the anxiety keeps on growing.

00:00:58.720 --> 00:01:00.340
Each time you chase certainty,

00:01:00.341 --> 00:01:02.681
the brain reinforces the cycle.

00:01:02.780 --> 00:01:08.720
And before you know it, anxiety keeps growing higher and higher,

00:01:08.980 --> 00:01:10.800
harder to control.

00:01:11.420 --> 00:01:13.580
Now let's look at the non anxious brain.

00:01:13.581 --> 00:01:17.841
It gets the same thought. What if I eat something contaminated?

00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.340
But instead of chasing certainty,

00:01:20.341 --> 00:01:22.981
it responds with, I don't know.

00:01:22.982 --> 00:01:24.341
Hopefully I don't get sick,

00:01:24.342 --> 00:01:27.581
but I don't know. It doesn't suppress it,

00:01:27.582 --> 00:01:30.941
it doesn't fight it. It just lets the thought be.

00:01:30.942 --> 00:01:33.521
So we're gonna put this piece right here.

00:01:34.180 --> 00:01:37.200
Another anxious thought, same response.

00:01:37.380 --> 00:01:39.840
And here is what is interesting,

00:01:40.020 --> 00:01:43.880
because the non anxious brain isn't reinforcing the need for certainty.

00:01:44.060 --> 00:01:48.280
Over time, the pieces from the non Anxious brain

00:01:48.660 --> 00:01:52.360
starts to unlearn the fear of uncertainty.

00:01:54.060 --> 00:01:57.360
The brain realizes uncertainty is part of life.

00:01:57.380 --> 00:02:00.640
Bad things could happen regardless of my interventions.

00:02:01.740 --> 00:02:03.800
And instead of anxiety growing,

00:02:03.940 --> 00:02:06.340
it actually shrinks over time.

00:02:06.341 --> 00:02:08.621
You don't have to fear uncertainty.

00:02:08.622 --> 00:02:11.221
The moment you stop stacking the anxiety,

00:02:11.222 --> 00:02:14.121
your brain starts unlearning the fear.

and my job is to diagnose and treat mental health conditions

00:00:07.401 --> 00:00:09.320
alongside the classical low mood

00:00:09.321 --> 00:00:12.280
there are several other symptoms of depression that we look for

00:00:12.281 --> 00:00:15.300
here are five of them No. 1 fatigue

00:00:15.400 --> 00:00:17.760
also known as energia many people with depression

00:00:17.761 --> 00:00:20.600

00:00:20.601 --> 00:00:22.380
during a period of depression

00:00:22.640 --> 00:00:24.720
No.2 reduced interest

00:00:24.721 --> 00:00:26.640
another symptom is that when people become depressed

00:00:26.641 --> 00:00:30.620
they lose interest in the activities that they would usually enjoy doing

00:00:30.680 --> 00:00:33.880
the depression takes away the sense of fulfilment from doing those activities

00:00:33.881 --> 00:00:36.360
so people no longer have the motivation to do them

00:00:36.361 --> 00:00:38.700
No. 3 inappropriate guilt

00:00:38.720 --> 00:00:40.680
when people's depression is particularly severe

00:00:40.681 --> 00:00:41.960
they can start to feel guilty

00:00:41.961 --> 00:00:44.760
about things that they really shouldn't feel guilty about

00:00:44.761 --> 00:00:47.640
in particular people with depression can feel guilty about the impact

00:00:47.641 --> 00:00:50.600
that their illness is having on other people

00:00:50.601 --> 00:00:52.980
and this can lead to worsening of the depression

00:00:53.040 --> 00:00:55.240
No.4 trouble concentrating

00:00:55.241 --> 00:00:56.640
when people are particularly depressed

00:00:56.641 --> 00:00:58.680
their ability to focus on education

00:00:58.681 --> 00:01:00.960
work and other activities can diminish

00:01:00.961 --> 00:01:03.600
to the point where they're no longer able to function well

00:01:03.601 --> 00:01:06.520
and No. 5 thoughts of not wanting to be alive

00:01:06.521 --> 00:01:09.280
in severe depression people can feel like a burden to other people

00:01:09.281 --> 00:01:10.760
and they can have thoughts or feelings

00:01:10.761 --> 00:01:13.520
that things would be better if they were no longer alive

00:00:00.110 --> 00:00:02.709
"How can I help my partner dealing with depression?"

00:00:02.870 --> 00:00:05.189
I'm a psychologist and I'm going to give you a few pointers

00:00:05.390 --> 00:00:08.669
First one is that depression shows up differently for different people

00:00:08.670 --> 00:00:11.229
Sometimes it looks very irritable and moody

00:00:11.230 --> 00:00:13.029
Sometimes it looks very sad

00:00:13.190 --> 00:00:15.109
Sometimes it's very isolative

00:00:15.110 --> 00:00:19.629
It's important to ask your partner what it is that they need help with

00:00:19.680 --> 00:00:21.559
Some people will tell you what they need

00:00:21.560 --> 00:00:24.059
Some people will feel really guilty and not want to burden you

00:00:24.060 --> 00:00:26.279
and some people will insist that they are fine

00:00:26.280 --> 00:00:28.420
It's important to respect what someone says

00:00:28.880 --> 00:00:31.788
it's also important to continue to check in with them

00:00:31.789 --> 00:00:33.230
whether that's via text

00:00:33.389 --> 00:00:35.430
phone calls or in person

00:00:35.589 --> 00:00:38.319
your person will tell you what they are most comfortable with

00:00:38.320 --> 00:00:39.628
but when someone is depressed

00:00:39.629 --> 00:00:43.470
they tend to isolate and really lose connection with the rest of the world

00:00:43.509 --> 00:00:46.870
and sometimes as a result of that people forget to check in on them (forget emotional check ins especially)

00:00:47.000 --> 00:00:48.231
That's such an important thing

00:00:48.232 --> 00:00:51.027
to feel like you still matter to someone else

00:00:51.032 --> 00:00:54.271
if you know your person really well and what would be helpful for them

00:00:54.272 --> 00:00:57.511
you can offer to help them with things that maybe they're struggling with

00:00:57.512 --> 00:01:00.351
or that you know that they tend to lean on you for

00:01:00.352 --> 00:01:03.587
things like helping to clean up a space, "with their permissions"

00:01:03.907 --> 00:01:04.952
bringing food

00:01:05.187 --> 00:01:07.186
and maybe even finding a therapist

00:01:07.187 --> 00:01:08.091
because let's face it

00:01:08.092 --> 00:01:08.992
unfortunately

00:01:09.227 --> 00:01:11.150
it's a real challenge to find someone 

00:01:11.151 --> 00:01:11.859
something else

00:01:11.860 --> 00:01:15.232
that's really important is to open the door to the conversation of

00:01:15.307 --> 00:01:17.599
if you're ever feeling really helpless or hopeless

00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.506
or like it's getting really hard to live

00:01:19.507 --> 00:01:20.466
I want to know

00:01:20.467 --> 00:01:21.960
please tell me

00:01:21.961 --> 00:01:23.680
make it so that's not a taboo subject

00:01:23.681 --> 00:01:25.618
because the truth is that

00:01:25.721 --> 00:01:28.738
people think about death and dying a lot more than we know

00:01:28.761 --> 00:01:30.720
they just don't talk about it quite as much

00:01:30.721 --> 00:01:32.800
and if someone is really struggling with depression

00:01:32.801 --> 00:01:35.858
you want them to know it is okay for them to talk about it

00:01:35.960 --> 00:01:37.466
IF they choose to do so

00:01:37.513 --> 00:01:38.512
Those are just a few

00:01:38.513 --> 00:01:41.792
but if you or someone that you care about has ever struggled with depression

00:01:41.793 --> 00:01:44.032
please leave in the comments what has been helpful

00:01:44.033 --> 00:01:47.192
so we can share that information with everybody looking for

00:01:47.193 --> 00:01:48.832
how to support someone they care about

00:01:48.833 --> 00:01:51.414
who's also struggling with depression 

00:01:51.415 --> 00:01:52.026
THANKS.
